elements.title: Bäckadräkten (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bäckadräkten (pictured) is Sweden's first unisex folk costume?

elements.title: transgender archaeology (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that several ambiguously gendered figurines from pre-Columbian Ecuador can be analyzed through the lens of transgender archaeology?

elements.title: Cat Bird (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite the titular character of the game Cat Bird being a hybrid of a cat and a bird, critics thought the character looked more like a bat?

elements.title: Bayron Matos (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first words in English that National Football League player Bayron Matos knew were "I'm hungry"?

elements.title: A Spy on Mother Midnight (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1748 chapbook A Spy on Mother Midnight is studied for its sex scenes with cross-dressing and a dildo?

elements.title: Asha Sobhana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Asha Sobhana is the first Indian player to take a five-wicket haul in the Women's Premier League?

elements.title: Clean (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the posthumously released documentary Clean centered on the life of Sandra Pankhurst, a former sex worker, drag queen, and crime scene cleaner?

elements.title: Shilshole (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the last twenty residents of the only Shilshole village on Salmon Bay in Seattle were evicted in 1914 to allow the creation of the Ballard Locks?

elements.title: Darwin Rocksitters Club (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Darwin Rocksitters Club had "no funny business" as their first, third, and fifth rules?
